alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall from Thursday and Friday morning continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including southeastern Weld County. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 612 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding along streams and low-lying areas in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Sand Creek, Mule Creek, Jack Rabbit Creek, East Lost Creek, Comanche Creek, Sand Creek, Rock Creek, South Platte River, Kiowa Creek and Lost Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Low lying areas around Roggen northward to Empire Reservoir.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
